cities.name: Vienna
cities.description: Imperial city with museums and classical music at every step. Schönbrunn Palace and the Ringstrasse embody baroque and historicism, while cafés like Demel maintain the pastry tradition.

cities.name: Bruges
cities.description: Perfectly preserved medieval center, tree-lined canals, and cobbled squares like the Markt. Belfries, guild houses, and chocolate shops create a fairytale atmosphere.

cities.name: Copenhagen
cities.description: Balance between contemporary design and Nordic tradition. Nyhavn, Tivoli, and cycling neighborhoods show a human and welcoming city.

cities.name: Ljubljana
cities.description: Small and scenic capital, with a pedestrian center, riverside cafés, and a hilltop castle. Ideal base for trips to Lake Bled.

cities.name: Barcelona
cities.description: Gaudi's modernism, sea, and mountains in one shot. Sagrada Familia, Park Güell, and neighborhood life coexist with markets and museums.

cities.name: Seville
cities.description: Monumental historic center, patios, and tiles. The Alcázar, the Cathedral, and the Santa Cruz neighborhood join a powerful tapas and flamenco culture.

cities.name: Tallinn
cities.description: Walled medieval old town, towers, and colorful roofs overlooking the Baltic. Cold winters, but photogenic from Toompea.

cities.name: Paris
cities.description: Urban romance: Seine, boulevards, and iconic museums. Neighborhoods with their own identity; Notre Dame, Sacré-Coeur, and the Eiffel Tower as essential landmarks.

cities.name: Budapest
cities.description: Art Nouveau architecture, thermal baths, and night walks on the Danube. The Parliament shines at sunset from the Chain Bridge.

cities.name: Florence
cities.description: Cradle of the Renaissance: Duomo, Uffizi, and crafts in the Oltrarno. A living museum-city where every street holds sculptures and palaces.

cities.name: Rome
cities.description: The 'Eternal City' combines classical ruins, baroque squares, and neighborhood life. From the Pantheon to the Trevi Fountain, history coexists with trattorias.

cities.name: Venice
cities.description: Car-free with a unique aquatic layout. Canals, palaces, and bridges connect islands; from San Marco to quieter neighborhoods.

cities.name: Valletta
cities.description: Fortified and baroque, overlooking the Grand Harbour. Palaces, churches, and museums concentrated in a compact, walkable center.

cities.name: Bergen
cities.description: Wooden houses in Bryggen, lively harbor, and mountains dropping into fjords. Perfect starting point for scenic routes.

cities.name: Amsterdam
cities.description: UNESCO canals, narrow gables, and cycling culture. World-class museums and green neighborhoods connected by bridges.

cities.name: Porto
cities.description: Tiles, bridges over the Douro, and Port wine cellars. Lello Bookstore and Leça pools as contemporary icons.

cities.name: London
cities.description: History and avant-garde on the banks of the Thames. Free museums, immense parks, and an endless cultural and gastronomic scene.

cities.name: Edinburgh
cities.description: Royal Mile, castle, and green hills. Arthur’s Seat offers an exceptional panoramic view over the stone city.

cities.name: Prague
cities.description: Gothic domes and towers over a photogenic old town. Charles Bridge at sunrise and historic cafés with music and literature.

cities.name: Lucerne
cities.description: Lake, nearby mountains, and the Chapel Bridge as a postcard. Medieval roofs and alpine air just minutes from hiking trails.

cities.name: Zurich
cities.description: Elegant old town by the lake, museums, galleries, and life by the water. Vibrant summers and Swiss efficiency in every detail.

cities.name: Reykjavik
cities.description: Modern architecture like Harpa and Hallgrímskirkja amidst volcanic landscapes. Base for auroras and nearby thermal baths.

cities.name: Beijing
cities.description: Imperial capital with the Forbidden City, hutongs, and wide avenues. Gateway to nearby sections of the Great Wall.

cities.name: Hong Kong
cities.description: Dense skyline around a harbor full of ferries. Mountains, islands, and nature reserves minutes from the financial center.

cities.name: Seoul
cities.description: Skyscrapers and palaces, night markets, and an impeccable subway network. Districts like Bukchon and Myeongdong show tradition and fashion.

cities.name: Jaipur
cities.description: The 'Pink City': Hawa Mahal, forts, and salmon-colored bazaars. Crafts, jewelry, and Rajasthani cuisine in palaces and streets.

cities.name: Kyoto
cities.description: Temples, shrines, and classic gardens. Hanami in spring, tree-lined routes, and the chance to spot geishas in Gion.

cities.name: Luang Prabang
cities.description: UNESCO heritage site at the river confluence. Monk processions at dawn, nearby waterfalls, and colonial-Buddhist architecture.

cities.name: Beirut
cities.description: Beaches, clubs, and rooftops facing historic mosques and souks. Gastronomy and nightlife with a Mediterranean and Levantine flair.

cities.name: Muscat
cities.description: Bays and mountains framing mosques, souks, and Portuguese forts. Coastal walks and white architecture along the Gulf of Oman.

cities.name: Doha
cities.description: Corniche with futuristic skyline, Souq Waqif, and the Museum of Islamic Art. A blend of tradition and new cultural areas.

cities.name: Chiang Mai
cities.description: Hillside temples, cafés, and creative markets. Starting point for northern nature and intense culinary experiences.

cities.name: Hanoi
cities.description: Lakes, temples, and French quarter with romantic flair. Narrow streets with traditional cafés and vibrant markets.

cities.name: Singapore
cities.description: Garden city with urban jungle, Botanic Gardens, and Gardens by the Bay. Temples, heritage houses, and impeccable logistics.

cities.name: Chefchaouen
cities.description: Blue medina in the Rif mountains. Painted alleys, artisan doors, and nearby viewpoints to see the whole town from above.

cities.name: Cape Town
cities.description: Table Mountain, penguin beaches, and colorful neighborhoods like Bo-Kaap. Gardens, nearby vineyards, and scenic coastal routes.

cities.name: Sydney
cities.description: Iconic Opera House, navigable harbor, and urban beaches like Bondi. Daily ferries and parks facing the water.

cities.name: Queenstown
cities.description: Adrenaline capital between lake and mountains. Natural viewpoints, adventures, and cinematic landscapes.

cities.name: Quebec City
cities.description: Walled city on high ground overlooking the St. Lawrence. European atmosphere, steep roofs, and pink sunsets.

cities.name: Havana
cities.description: Colonial architecture in pastel tones, music on every corner, and seaside walks. Old Havana and the Malecón set the pace.

cities.name: New York
cities.description: Iconic architecture, parks like Central Park, and an incomparable art scene. Urban energy that never sleeps.

cities.name: San Francisco
cities.description: Golden Gate Bridge, hills, and Victorian houses. World-class museums and neighborhoods with their own character.

cities.name: San Miguel de Allende
cities.description: Colonial center with pink neo-gothic parish church. Cobbled streets, courtyards, and art in galleries and workshops.

cities.name: Buenos Aires
cities.description: Neighborhoods with identity (Recoleta, San Telmo, La Boca), varied architecture, and intense cultural life. Tango, steakhouses, and bookstores in iconic buildings.

cities.name: Rio de Janeiro
cities.description: Mythical beaches, urban jungle, and Christ the Redeemer watching over bays and hills. Samba rhythm in streets and squares.

cities.name: Cartagena
cities.description: Walls, plazas, and colonial mansions covered in bougainvillea. Getsemaní and Bocagrande show their creative and modern faces.

cities.name: Quito
cities.description: Golden historic center under Andean volcanoes. Views from the Basilica of the National Vow and traditional markets.

cities.name: Cusco
cities.description: Former Inca capital with squares, convents, and cobbled streets. Starting point to Machu Picchu and viewpoints like Christo Blanco.
